entry.title: Prosecutor: FTX Boss Sam Bankman-Fried Stole Billions From Customers, Lied About It
entry.summary:
Federal prosecutor Nicolas Roos argued this week that Sam Bankman-Fried stole billions in customer funds from his cryptocurrency exchange FTX and lied repeatedly to cover it up, actions that make him guilty on all counts. The prosecutorâ€™s closing argument paints a picture of Bankman-Fried building a mountain of lies that eventually collapsed, â€œleaving countless victims in its wake.â€
From Crypto King to the Courtroomâ€™s Closing Arguments: The Bankman-Fried Saga
Almost a year ago, customers began trying to withdraw funds from FTX, but their requests went unprocessed as FTX went bankrupt with $10 billion missing, prosecutor Roos told the court on Novemeber 1, 2023. The federal governmentâ€™s closing argument was published by Matthew Russell Lee from the Inner City Press.
Roos argued that Sâ€¦

entry.title: PayPalâ€™s $158M PYUSD Stablecoin Market Cap Shaken By SEC Subpoena
entry.summary:
In a recent report by Reuters, online payment system company PayPal announced plans to bolster its market value by $4 billion, seeking to streamline operations to appease investors. However, investor optimism was tempered by disclosing a subpoena from the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) related to PayPalâ€™s stablecoin PYUSD.
PayPalâ€™s $4 Billion Value Boost Amidst SEC Subpoena
Before market opening on Thursday, PayPalâ€™s shares surged by 7% to reach $55.16, fueled by a full-year profit forecast that assuaged concerns of a spending slowdown.Â
The companyâ€™s new CEO, Alex Chriss, acknowledged the need for cost reduction, stating, â€œSimply put, our cost base remains too high.â€ Chriss emphasized aligning resources with the most profitable growth priorities in their strategic realiâ€¦

entry.title: Octoberâ€™s NFT Market Contracts Over 21%, With Ethereumâ€™s Share Shrinking by $35 Million
entry.summary:
October proved to be a beneficial period for the broader crypto asset landscape; however, it cast a shadow on the non-fungible token (NFT) sector, witnessing a 21.64% dip in sales. Ethereumâ€™s NFTs took the lionâ€™s share, amassing $171 million out of the $313 million total, despite experiencing a 17.26% decrease in sales volume over the course of the month.
NFT Market Contracts in October
The non-fungible token (NFT) market has experienced a substantial decrease in value from its peak, paralleled by a considerable slump in sales. Data gathered by cryptoslam.io highlights a pronounced downward trend in sales starting from February 2023.
In the span of a month, from the close of September to the end of October 2023, the market saw $313.37 million in NFT sales. Nonetheless, the previousâ€¦

entry.title: The Most Important Highlights From Rippleâ€™s XRP Markets Report
entry.summary:
Ripple recently released its Q3 2023 XRP Markets Report as part of the companyâ€™s efforts to provide transparency and updates on â€œkey industry developments and crypto markets movements.â€ The report also highlighted some of the impressive strides the company made in the third quarter of this year.Â
How The Crypto Market Fared in Q3 2023
The report noted that the crypto market was majorly unaffected by trends in the broader macro assets and, instead, reacted majorly to industry-specific news and flows of capital. To back this up, Ripple mentioned that Bitcoin decoupled from stocks as BTCâ€™s correlation to the S&P hit historic lows at 0.23 throughout the third quarter of this year.Â

entry.title: Leading Swiss Bank SGKB Unveils Bitcoin And Ethereum Trading Service
entry.summary:
St. Galler Kantonalbank (SGKB), a pillar of Swiss banking since 1868, has officially expanded into cryptocurrency services, offering its clients the opportunity to trade and custody Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH). This strategic move is facilitated through a partnership with SEBA Bank, a FINMA-regulated entity specializing in digital assets, as Swiss news outlet CVJ.CH reports.
Swiss Banks Launches Bitcoin And ETH Trading
The integration of Bitcoin and Ethereum offerings places SGKB among the vanguard of Swiss banks embracing the digital asset revolution. The fifth-largest cantonal bank in Switzerland now provides wealth-management clients with regulated custody and trading services, with plans to extend these services to retail customers.
SEBA Bankâ€™s head of investment solutions, â€¦

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Friedâ€™s Attorney Paints Picture of Mistakes, Not Crimes, in Closing Argument
entry.summary:
Sam Bankman-Friedâ€™s lawyer Mark Cohen gave a final argument Wednesday, portraying the FTX founder as someone who â€œdid his bestâ€ and made mistakes but did not commit crimes.
Bankman-Friedâ€™s Lawyer: â€˜Mistakes Are Not a Crimeâ€™
Sam Bankman-Friedâ€˜s attorney, Mark Cohen, is well-known for representing convicted sex offender Ghislaine Maxwell. This year, he is defending the former FTX chief. After a series of witnesses and testimony from Bankman-Fried himself, Cohen delivered his closing argument to the courtroom jurors.
â€œMistakes are not a crime. Why does the government get to speak twice? Because they have the burden of proof,â€ Cohen told jurors in his closing statement. He said the government tried to turn Bankman-Fried into â€œsome sort of monsterâ€ but had not shown criminal intent. Coheâ€¦
